action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is to brew a potion following the potion recipe.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a bed, a book, a wardrobe and a potion recipe. The pillow is on the floor. The book is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. The potion recipe is on the bed. There is a passage to a reading room here.
action.label: context

action.content: You take the potion recipe. In your inventory you have a potion recipe.
action.label: context

action.content: The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.
action.label: context

action.label: context

action.content:
You read the potion recipe:
That odd potion
Ingredients: Ectoplasm, spiderweb, nightshade, lily of the valley.
1. Pour ectoplasm into your cauldron.
2. Add the lily of the valley into your cauldron.
3. Put the spiderweb into your cauldron.
4. Wiggle a zulpowand at your cauldron.
5. Wiggle a ice wand on your cauldron.
6. Put the nightshade into your cauldron.
action.label: context
